title: Design Literacy-Based Online Course for Enhancing Mathematical Thinking Skills

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical concepts and basic digital tool usage skills
context.additional_context: Mathematics Education Course for Working Professionals Utilizing Design Thinking Methodology. Integrates Design Literacy and Mathematical Problem-Solving Skills Through Making-Based Learning Activities in a BYOD Environment

learning_goals: Learners can apply the design thinking process to transform real-world problems into mathematical modeling
Learners can use digital fabrication tools (graph generators, 3D modeling toolkits, etc.) to visually represent mathematical concepts
Learners can share design prototypes and incorporate feedback through online collaboration platforms with peers

resources: LMS platform (video lectures, discussion board, assignment submission system)
Digital Production Tools (Free Versions, e.g., Desmos, Tinkercad)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
